injuries.shortComment: Walker won't play Friday against the Thunder due to left knee soreness.
injuries.longComment: Walker wasn't listed on the Knicks' injury report ahead of Friday's matchup, but he'll be unavailable against Oklahoma City. His absence should lead to additional opportunities for Immanuel Quickley and Miles McBride.

injuries.shortComment: The Knicks plan to sign Mooney (not injury related) to another 10-day hardship contract Friday, Michael Scotto of USA Today reports.
injuries.longComment: Mooney is currently listed as not with the team, but he's expected to stick with the Knicks for another 10 days. He only made one appearance -- playing two minutes -- during his first contract, so he isn't expected to crack fantasy relevancy during his second contract.

injuries.shortComment: House (finger) is out for Friday's matchup against the Thunder.
injuries.longComment: House is missing a fourth straight game due to a dislocated right finger. His next chance to play is Sunday against the Raptors.

injuries.shortComment: Rose underwent right ankle surgery Wednesday and will be re-evaluated in eight weeks.
injuries.longComment: Rose was already ruled out for his third consecutive game Thursday due to the ankle issue, and he'll now be sidelined for at least two months after undergoing surgery. Kemba Walker figures to see more run during his absence in what is a big blow for the Knicks.
